website_summaries.verdict: Lighter-weight hammer with the force of a heavier tool because of titanium construction.
pros: Titanium head designed to pack a punch without the wear on your hands and arms that steel-head hammer delivers
Not very heavy if you wear a hammer all day long
cons: May be less durable than steel-headed models

customer_reviews.title: China made!
customer_reviews.text: This product is not made in the USA And is not made of Ruger titanium. It's made in China!!! So that's why I returned it!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one . First one lasted me 16 years and was still good until it was lost ...I'm a finish carpenter by trade but that doesn't mean didnt pry , demo and pull nails with this thing .I was very abusive on this little guy. On occasion I would reset the head down snug and belt sand the claws sharp again .It was a struggle working without it and so happy to have another back in my bags !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth the cost. Save your tendons and joints now so you can keep working in the future.
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammer. I am beginning a career as a carpenter and I am going to do this the right way- working smarter, not harder. I want my wrists and elbows and tendons to last a long time. Stiletto hammers make that so much easier. It weighs about half of the heavy metal hammers I'd started using. Absolutely worth the extra cost, given how much physical therapy costs and being off work to heal tendonitis and related injuries. This size is just right for trim work, and I also have the 18 waffle face for framing. Do your future self a favor and invest in a couple of these hammers.
customer_reviews.author: Artemis

customer_reviews.title: Smart hammer
customer_reviews.text: Best hammer I ever owned. Really light, easy on your wrists. No heavy duty, don’t go trying to smash concrete with it. This size is perfect for finish carpentry and work around the house. For framing get the bigger sizes. Price could always be a little lower but carpal tunnel can also be very expensive, so you save a lot. Plus not everything counts in money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, high performance, love it.
customer_reviews.text: Recently received this hammer and so far I love it. As stated in other reviews, this hammer absolutely disappears in your tool belt. If you carry a hammer daily you’ll appreciate this many times over I promise. Initially i was worried about its ability to drive fasteners as well as my 16oz steel dewalt; Those worries vanished after the first nail I set. I felt the stiletto drove nails faster and easier than my previous hammer without question. This will probably be the only hammer I carry as a finish carpenter from here on out I’m very happy. I cannot yet speak on its durability although I expect it to be solid and will update if otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Feels so light yet packs a punch.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to get my first titanium hammer. I had some coupons and grabbed this one. The lite feel is remarkable. Yet the nails still drive well. Nice hickory handle a tiny bit fat in my hand. My hands fit in large size glove so if you wear a medium glove size you may not like the feel of the handle.
customer_reviews.author: philipma1957

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable!
customer_reviews.text: This hammer is great for being lightweight but not very durable. The picture is of the face after driving in 25 nails 2 inches long into HardyBoard siding. My 15 year old Stanley hammer has no face damage and has driven thousands of nails.
customer_reviews.author: HEQT

customer_reviews.title: great finishing hammer for the house
customer_reviews.text: the wooden handle is comfortable, the titanium head light...makes for a perfect finishing hammer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Need better adhesive for magnet on nail holder
customer_reviews.text: Hundred dollar hammer and the magnet fell out of head first time I tried to stick a nail on it. Strikes like a dream
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Lightest best hammer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was in need of. After swinging a hammer for almost 20 years and now only siding homes,it's a light weight option that saves my elbow and performs up to high standards! Lightest best hammer I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect hammer.
customer_reviews.text: This one was just right. I build scenery professionally. I could carry this all day on by tool belt while climbing around the set and it didn't hurt my back or hips at the end of the week. I'd keep a different hammer on hand for demo jobs, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice hammer but a couple immediate flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Brand new, tapped the end of a board and the magnet fell out. I epoxied it back in, too much fuss to send it back for that. Use better glue or whatever TF you use to retain the magnet. Handle is a little too smooth.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hogue

customer_reviews.title: Most important very comfortable to my hand
customer_reviews.text: I use it for small trim work. this is not a framing hammer. Most important very comfortable to my hand.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as good as my heavy framer
customer_reviews.text: Every bit as good as my heavy framer, except now my elbow doesn't hurt anymore. I have a 14 oz that I thought I would use for framing but I pretty much only use the 10. Does it all.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Howell

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer
customer_reviews.text: I have used stiletto for 3 1/2 years. They are great hammers. They are expensive but well worth the price. I would recommend to anyone, and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Carpenter approved
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we got this hammer, my husband loves it and recommends to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Angela F Deitz

customer_reviews.title: nice hammer
customer_reviews.text: it hits hard good feel .this is a finish hammer.
customer_reviews.author: bobbyjo

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply a bad ass hammer. Feels great. Used to use a vaughn 16 oz for hanging vinyl. This is not a framing hammer, got to go heavier for that.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G.

customer_reviews.title: Best hammer
customer_reviews.text: The price was the key. I have seen these same hammers for up to $80.00. Great deal
customer_reviews.author: Greg Lang

customer_reviews.title: Think about it
customer_reviews.text: It's like buying an expensive tie. Do you really need it? Yes, says Mr. McMoney-Bags.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, doesn’t seem like the same quality titanium like the ruger they used to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% Sold on Titanium Hammers
customer_reviews.text: Got this hammer and while it was nice to use, I feel that especially in tight places it's harder to get a good swing without the weight we're used to. That's really a minor concern though. My real concern is the durability of the titanium. I put this hammer through the paces of a medium duty project and already the claws are worn and chipped in a way I'd expect of a decade old steel hammer. I don't hate it but for the price I certainly don't love it either, which could constitute a problem based on the thickness of your pocketbook.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Honcho

customer_reviews.title: Resi Electricians:
customer_reviews.text: Buy this! I never thought I fall in love with a particular hammer, but here it is. *Would love to try an m4 though
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best hammer I've ever bought, life saver for my injured arm. It arrived the same day I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: John Shane

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: Stiletto FH10-C 10-Ounce Titanium Finish Hammer is perfect light and powerful
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad elbow and swinging a big hammer was to much this worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M Anzalone

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hammer. This 10 oz. hammer works just as good as the 16 oz. steel ones. I got one for myself and my daughter and son-in-law. My daughter said it is now her hammer of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammer it’s light weight and doesn’t weigh my bags down
customer_reviews.author: christopher m. everett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hammer
customer_reviews.text: Light weight but still able to drive nails. Great finish hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle D. Chodrick

customer_reviews.title: cool tool
customer_reviews.text: this hammer rocks. was afraid to use it at first but it came thru in flying colors. still getting use to the lite weight of the hammer but am looking forward to spending many years with this hammer.
customer_reviews.author: douglas cahail

customer_reviews.title: The hammer was great. I have one and the one that I ...
customer_reviews.text: The hammer was great. I have one and the one that I orded is for my son. The only thing that could be corrected is the packaging. The claw of the hammer was sticking out of the box, it had broken thru
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Stickers on the handle
customer_reviews.text: Love the hammer but some moron put bar code stickers on the handle with adhesive that does not release without solvent. Apparently whoever puts the stickers on has never used a hammer and/or does not know what the handle is for. I should not have to spend half an hour cleaning the handle on an $88 hammer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Mellgren

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my friend
customer_reviews.text: Says he should have bought one ten years ago. He loves it. Awesome features with the magnet and nail set. Best hammer ever used. We nail about 2000-4000 nails a day.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Darko

customer_reviews.title: Very light and a comfortable handle
customer_reviews.text: I'm an electrician, and I carry a hammer around most of the day. I wanted something light and this is it. Drives a mail about as good as a normal hammer. Works better than normal in confined spaces where only short swings can be managed.
customer_reviews.author: catsupdog

customer_reviews.title: Best hammer money can buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have the 14 oz n love it and I bought the smaller 10 oz for my dad because he has a bad elbow and he'll never go back to a steel hammer again.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: This hammer quickly became my new favorite. If you want to lighten your toolbelt and still have a full size finish hammer at your disposal, this is your ticket.
customer_reviews.author: David Eastman

customer_reviews.title: light,
customer_reviews.text: i used the hammer to put up cedar shingles. it sure beat the 16 or 20 oz hammer in that i could use it all day and not tire. i wouldn't want to use it to bang in spikes as i don't think it is designed for that, but for finish work or puting up wood shingles it sure met my needs. rather expensive. i don't think i would recommend it if you weren't going to do something light and a lot of it.
customer_reviews.author: gus

customer_reviews.title: work hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same hammer my husband wore out (and then broke the handle off of.) Great utility hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Knight

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just as expected and was shipped way soon then expected!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Hamer so light on the belt you can hardly tell it's there but it does the job it's made for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless for any kind of precision finish work
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight hammer BUT the head was installed crooked and cants to the right in relation to the handle. Useless for any kind of precision finish work. Immediately returned it for full refund. Will stay with the heavier yet much better built Estwing.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best hammer ever supper light and it swings like a dream. There is no other hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Riddles

customer_reviews.title: sweet hammer
customer_reviews.text: these are great hammers. They are now made in China REALLY. The quality is fine, just not what they used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Best finish hammer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best finish hammer I have ever owned! Love the weight and still has plenty of power. Im a finish carpenter and this is the only hammer I will carry from now on. Very comfortable handle and durable construction. Stiletto makes nice hammers that are worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: EHI, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Great Finish Hammer
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for two days now installing cedar clapboard siding. All hand nailing with SS ring shanks. This hammer is really nice, the light weight makes it almost disappear from the weight of your tool belt but has the hitting power of a steel 16 oz hammer. Update: I have had the hammer for many months now and I still love it. It had held up very well even when using it with nail sets and pry bars.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: ANOTHER SUPER PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: USE THIS ONE EVERY DAY AND FOR ITS SIZE ITS HUMONGUS. LITE BUT DOES SUPER JOB FOR IT'S SIZE AND WEIGHT..
customer_reviews.author: rodger g palmer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product except the cheap Chinese made wood handle. The older one is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to use. Lightweight with plenty of power. Great hammer. Will be buying another in the future for framing.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Titsworth

customer_reviews.title: Stiletto 10-Ounce Titanium Finish Hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice hammer! I'd been wanting a light weight finish hammer for some time and I knew Stiletto has always been considered the premier hammer. When in my tool belt my old steel hammer hits me in the knee when in the front holder or bangs around when in the rear holder. This hammer works in either holder and you hardly know it's there. The only negative about this hammer is that it's made in China.
customer_reviews.author: BayouBuilt

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer for finish carpenters, No need for anything heavier, not driving 16d framing nails. Made minor modifications to the handle ( shaped it to be more ergonomic) restained and put a couple coats of lacquer. Don't really need the nail starter magnet and groove. But I don't see much of a draw back in having it there. All and all a good product to lighten you pouches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, not well made
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, not well made. Face of hammer has very poor finish. Sweet spot is about 1/8" circle somewhere near the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Tschetter

customer_reviews.title: arm saver
customer_reviews.text: I've been re-shingling my house with alot of over head nailing and the old 16 oz hammer was getting too heavy . This one drives a nail as well with much less strain and effort
customer_reviews.author: MWM

customer_reviews.title: This is a great hammer. It more than meet my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hammer. It more than meet my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Stiletto FH10C Claw Hammer
product_meta.description:
Stiletto finishing hammer, straight claw, 10 oz head, 14-1/2 in overall length, milled face, 1-1/4 in face diameter, titanium head, curved Axe handle, hickory handle, Brown/tan handle.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This lightweight 10-ounce titanium finish hammer has the striking force of 16-ounce steel. Engineered for the user, this titanium hammer is a precision nail driving tool. Its 13.5-inch curved axe style hickory handle offers extreme durability and great comfort. This hammer features a smooth face. Lightweight and powerful, the overall length is 14-1/4 inches and it weighs only 16.6 ounces. This 10-ounce titanium finish hammer does not have the nail slot in the face to mar finish work, and also features a tight radius claw design to pull finish nails easily without leaving marks in your work.
feature_bullets: Stiletto finishing hammer, straight claw, 10 oz head, 14-1/2 in overall length, milled face, 1-1/4 in face diameter, titanium head, curved Axe handle, hickory handle, Brown/tan handle
Provides secure connections to components and lines
This product is manufactured in United States
Driving power of a 16-ounce steel hammer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars170 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
